DataElement.preferredName: Synchronous Bilateral Breast Disease Assessment Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response related to the assessments of synchronous bilateral breast disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring at the same time or rate._Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs._A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the breast. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include fibrocystic disease, gynecomastia, and mastitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include fibroadenoma, lobular neoplasia, carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring at the same time or rate.:Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.:A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the breast. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include fibrocystic disease, gynecomastia, and mastitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include fibroadenoma, lobular neoplasia, carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.

Concepts.definition: Occurring at the same time or rate.
Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.

A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the breast. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include fibrocystic disease, gynecomastia, and mastitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include fibroadenoma, lobular neoplasia, carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
